page.title: 06D.B. PLOUGH AND HARROW.
page.content: The Plough and Harrow Public House is owned by{Mrs. Bovey.}The pub has been standing for{400 years,}though when it was built it wasn't intended to be a pub. It was a{coaching house,} as there used to be a road on the other side of it. Mrs. Bovey didn't know how the pub got its name, but presumed it was because of a farm nearby. She has owned it for twenty_six years and the previous owner was called Mr. Lilley. She employs sixteen people and serves hot meals. The most popular meal is steak. Outside is an{old plough}which is sixty years old. It was there when Mrs. Bovey took over. While she has owned the pub there has not been any trouble or fighting. In Drakes Broughton there are two pubs. The other is called The Old Oak.
